p: At the end of day 10, all animals which had undergone CUS protocol showed a significant ( P < 0.001) increase in duration of immobility in FST when compared with the baseline ( Fig. 1A). The OEO administered to the stressed animals produced significant ( P < 0.05) decrease in the duration of immobility when compared with CUS group. Fluoxetine significantly reduced the duration of immobility ( P < 0.01) when compared to CUS group. In CUS + saline group the immobility time was significantly higher than the baseline ( P < 0.05) ( Fig. 1A).
